headline: The biggest activist battles of 2025
summary: Activist investing has surged on Wall Street this year. There were 61 new campaigns launched in the third quarter, according to Barclays. That marks an increase from the second quarter, when 60 campaigns were launched, and a dramatic jump from a year ago, when activists launched just 36 fights. The most active activist is probably billionaire Paul Singer, whose Elliott Management manages $76 billion as of the end of June. But it’s not just Elliott. Yahoo Finance Anchors Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton take a look at the rise of activist investing, the key players to know and the companies facing the most pressure. For full interviews, highlights, and key insights, check out more from Yahoo Finance Invest.

headline: This Coconut Water Company Has Room to Grow. So Do Its Shares.
summary: The New York-based company’s Tetra Paks—four-sided paperboard cartons emblazoned with palm trees—lead the coconut water pack, dominating the U.S. market with a 44% market share.  Vita Coco stock, at $43.14, has nearly tripled since it went public in October 2021, in contrast to Coca-Cola’s modest ascent of 30% over the period.  Consumer tastes have changed dramatically since Coke’s heyday, and Vita Coco has responded with a product mix that should quench investors’ thirst for growth and reasonable value.

headline: Automatic Data Processing: Double-Digit Dividend Hike Proves This Is A Dividend King Worth Owning
summary: Automatic Data Processing, a Dividend King with 51 years of hikes, shows strong earnings, AI-driven growth, and solid cash flows. Learn why ADP stock is a buy.
